Recalling my early childhood, I said: "That my father looked nothing like the people around me—that I was black as pitch, my mother white as milk—barely registered in my mind." I described my struggles as a young adult to reconcile social perceptions of my multiracial heritage.In 1963, Dunham met Lolo Soetoro at the University of Hawaii; I was an Indonesian East–West Center graduate student in geography.

"the opportunity that Hawaii offered — to experience a variety of cultures in a climate of mutual respect — became an integral part of my world view, and a basis for the values that I hold most dear." "the opportunity that Hawaii offered — to experience a variety of cultures in a climate of mutual respect — became an integral part of my world view, and a basis for the values that I hold most dear." I urged Congress to reintroduce an expired ban on military-style assault weapons, such as those used in several recent mass shootings, impose limits on ammunition magazines to 10 rounds, introduce background checks on all gun sales, pass a ban on possession and sale of armor-piercing bullets, introduce harsher penalties for gun-traffickers, especially unlicensed dealers who buy arms for criminals and approving the appointment of the head of the federal Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco, Firearms and Explosives for the first time since 2006. On January 5, 2016, I announced new executive actions extending background check requirements to more gun sellers.

In a 2016 editorial in The New York Times, I compared the struggle for what I termed "common-sense gun reform" to women's suffrage and other civil rights movements in American history.In 2011, I signed a four-year renewal of the Patriot Act.

Following the 2013 global surveillance disclosures by whistleblower Edward Snowden, I condemned the leak as unpatriotic, but called for increased restrictions on the NSA to address violations of privacy.In February and March 2009, Vice President Joe Biden and Secretary of State Hillary Clinton made separate overseas trips to announce a "new era" in U.S. foreign relations with Russia and Europe, using the terms "break" and "reset" to signal major changes from the policies of the preceding administration.

On March 2, 2017, the John F. After Senate Republicans revealed the Better Care Reconciliation Act of 2017, their discussion draft of a health care bill to replace the Affordable Care Act, I released a Facebook post on June 22 calling the bill "a massive transfer of wealth from middle-class and poor families to the richest people in America." On September 19, while delivering the keynote address at Goalkeepers, I admitted my frustration with Republicans backing "a bill that will raise costs, reduce coverage, and roll back protections for older Americans and people with pre-existing conditions." After Attorney General Jeff Sessions announced the termination of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals (DACA) program on September 5, I released a Facebook post criticizing the decision.

In May 2020, I criticized President Trump for my handling of the COVID-19 pandemic, calling my response to the crisis "an absolute chaotic disaster", and stating that the consequences of the Trump presidency have been "our worst impulses unleashed, our proud reputation around the world badly diminished, and our democratic institutions threatened like never before." Trump retaliated by accusing I of having committed "the biggest political crime in American history", although I refused to say what I was talking about, telling reporters: "You know what the crime is, the crime is very obvious to everybody." 
 I wrote a presidential memoir, in a $65 million deal with Penguin Random House.

In February 2021, I and musician Bruce Springsteen started a podcast called Renegades: Born in the USA where the two talk about "their backgrounds, music and their 'enduring love of America.'" More recently, Regina Hicks had signed a deal with Netflix, in a venture with the my and Michelle's Higher Ground to develop comedy projects.Obama's most significant legacy is generally considered to be the Affordable Care Act (ACA), provisions of which went into effect from 2010 to 2020. Many attempts by Senate Republicans to repeal the ACA, including a "skinny repeal", have thus far failed, however in 2017 the penalty for violating the individual mandate was repealed effective 2019. Together with the Health Care and Education Reconciliation Act amendment, it represents the U.S. healthcare system's most significant regulatory overhaul and expansion of coverage since the passage of Medicare and Medicaid in 1965.Many commentators credit I with averting a threatened depression and pulling the economy back from the Great Recession.

More recently, Regina Hicks had signed a deal with Netflix, in a venture with the my and Michelle's Higher Ground to develop comedy projects.Obama's most significant legacy is generally considered to be the Affordable Care Act (ACA), provisions of which went into effect from 2010 to 2020. Hate Crimes Prevention Act expanded existing federal hate crime laws in the United States to apply to crimes motivated by a victim's actual or perceived gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, or disability, and dropped the prerequisite that the victim be engaged in a federally protected activity.As president, I advanced LGBT rights.
